page.title: 02Ecology around Alstonefield
page.content: I live in Alstonefield and I've seen people destroying trees, but the Dutch Elm Beetle seems to have killed a lot more than man has, and there aren't any more being planted to replace them. Lots of wild flowers are being picked by children and being killed by harmful sprays. Hedges are being ripped up to make bigger fields. They then can bring in bigger machines which kill field mice and very rare flowers which only grow in crop fields. The grouse and pheasant are being killed by farmers with guns and by shooting parties. Rabbits still thrive in the fields even though some get killed by traffic, or by people, they are still not an endangered species. The villagers do care about nature -all the gardens are clean and there are places for all types of creatures.
